coverage.graph

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • coverage.graph.Path

  • public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    * The path is a list of nodes. The nodes can not be removed from a path. But the path can be extended. The path can generate a subpath from the path.
    Author:
    Jeff Offutt, modified by Wuzhi Xu, Date: Dec 12, 2006 modified by Nan Li

      • detour

        public boolean detour(Path p2)
        It is exactly implementation of detour in the textbook. Tour with Detours: Test path p is said to tour subpath q with detours if and only if every node in q is also in p in the same order p1.detour(p2) means that p1 tours p2 with Detours
        Parameters:
        p -
        Returns:
        true if p1 tours p2 with detours else return false

      • sidetrip

        public boolean sidetrip(Path p)
        It is exactly the implementation of sidetrip in the textbook Tour with Sidetrips: Test path p is said to tour subpath q with sidetrips if and only if every edge in q is also in p in the same order p1.sidetrip(p2) means that p1 tours p2 with Sidetrips
        Parameters:
        p -
        Returns:
        true if p1 tours p2 with sidetrips else return false

        a subpath from the position i to the end(position of a path from 0 to path.size()-1)

        Returns:
        a subpath from position i to the end

        public int indexOf(Path p)
        Parameters:

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the path with [] an example: [1, 2, 3] is represented for the path from node 1 to node 2 to node 3
